content.description: Start up a shallow corner system just left of Raked Over. Follow the path of least resistance to a headwall and traverse right past a bolt and into another corner. Follow the corner system to a ledge with a two bolt anchor. Rappel from anchor.
content.location: Just to the Right of Raked Over.

content.description: Start by climbing up thin cracks to the left of some large bushes and gain the obvious hand and fist crack above. Follow the ever widening crack above through an awkward offwidth until it exits up a blocky area which ends at the large Pine Tree above.
content.location: Located on a left facing wall. This is the first crack system you come across when approaching from the North side of Raker Peak.

content.description:
Start up a shallow crack system right of Under Raked. Pass a small bulge and gain access to the slab above. Now feel around like Hellen Keller reading a braille book. Good foot technique helps too. Climb to a two bolt anchor.

Pitch 2 climbs a steep series of edges and knobs until the angle backs off significantly and easy climbing can be had to the ledges above. Â Bring bail slings and a biner for the tree above, or walk off to the left.
content.location: Just to the Right of Under Raked.

content.description: Start up a hand and fist crack passing some large bushes to your right and gain the obvious crack system of Raked Over. About 40ft up, head left up the tips and finger crack that branches off to the left. Follow the finger crack until you can gain the arete. Follow the arete until it ends at a large ledge with a big ol obvious pine tree. Bring slings for the tree.
content.protection: Cams, .4 to 3". Nuts 1 set. Offsets useful.
content.location: Located on a right facing wall at the very north end of Raker Peak Wall. Its the very first steep crack system you'll pass when traversing in from the North.

content.description: Climb up an arching crack and undercling to the edge of an arete. Pull some wild moves up the arete staying in the crack and move left to the face above. Again, pull some wild move on the face and gain a ledge system above. Belay at a small tree.
content.protection: Cams, .3" to 2" Nuts, 1 set. 60m rope to rap from tree.
content.location: Just to the left of the Hellen Keller slab.
